title: Plastic pollution: Green light for 'historic' treaty - BBC
body: Plastic crisis needs binding treaty, report says. 'Staggering' levels of plastic pollution by 2040. Ocean garbage patch is immense plastic habitat. They say just as climate change has the Paris ...
readable_content:
- BBC News (2023-12-08): The world is set to get a global treaty to tackle plastic pollution. Nearly 200 countries have agreed to start negotiations on an international agreement to take action on the "plastic crisis". UN members are tasked with developing an over-arching framework for reducing plastic waste across the world. There is growing concern that discarded plastic is destroying habitats, harming wildlife, and contaminating the food chain.

What are your thoughts on this global initiative to tackle plastic pollution?
summary:
This global initiative to tackle plastic pollution is a significant step forward in addressing the pressing issue of plastic waste. The fact that nearly 200 countries have agreed to start negotiations on an international agreement reflects a growing awareness of the devastating impact of plastic pollution on the environment and wildlife. It's an important step towards developing a coordinated and comprehensive approach to reducing plastic waste on a global scale.
